title: Model Railways - Right Track 2 - Loco Building Pt2
description:
Right Track 2 - Locomotive Kit Building - Part 2 - 3Hrs


Since these DVDs are not available anymore, remember there are others like you who would like this material so PLEASE SEED ;-)


Tony Wright, to date, has built over 400 locos, mostly from kits.

In the Right Track series he builds an A2 Pacific from DJH and shows the different methods used on a 4F from Alan Gibson and a Prairie tank from South Eastern Finecast. 

In two programmes, recorded in his own workshops, he takes the kits from their basic components to completed running models in 4mm scale, "OO" gauge.

In this, the second of the two programmes, Tony completes the detailing of the locomotive body and finishes the models ready for painting. 

Contents of the DVD

DJH A2

Fitting the Handrails, Cab Roof and Chimney
Shaping Smoke Deflectors
Fitting Smoke Deflectors and Handrails
Tender Frames and Wheels
Making the Tender Body
Building the Valve Gear
Fitting Valve Gear
S.E. Finecast 61XX

Preparing the Boiler
Assembling the Boiler, Firebox and Cab
Fitting Handrails
Lamp Brackets and the Smokebox Door
Fixing the Chimney with Epoxy Resin
Cylinders and Valve Bars
Connecting rods
On the Test Track
Cylinder Drain Cocks
Alan Gibson 4F

Removing Brass Components
Forming the Firebox
Assembling Smokebox and Boiler
Cab Beading and Handrails
Tender Frames
Building the Tender Body
Marking for Handrail Pillars
Lamp Brackets and Other Details
Soldering Chimney and Dome
Making Boiler Bands
Final Tender Details

Important: Resolution = 768 x 576. However, I have encoded these from 8GB to a reasonable uploading size, so there will be the odd loss of definition here and there.
I used the H265 format, so if you have difficulty playing this file I suggest you download a media player like VLC
